item.title: NBA Star Luka Doncic Reveals Impressive Overwatch 2 Accomplishment
item.description:
Highlights

  • NBA star Luka Doncic achieved Top 500 rank in Overwatch 2, showcasing his dedication to competitive gaming despite his basketball commitments.
  • The upcoming May 14 update for Overwatch 2 includes significant enhancements for tank players and a collaboration with Porsche for a special D.Va skin.

NBA star Luka Doncic has made headlines, not for his skills on the basketball court, but for his remarkable achievement of reaching the top 500 in Overwatch 2 . Created by Blizzard Entertainment, Overwatch 2 is a captivating team-based shooter known for its diverse range of characters and dynamic gameplay. Building upon Overwatch 's success, the sequel introduces new heroes, maps, and game modes while refining core mechanics. With its emphasis on teamwork and skillful play, Overwatch 2 continues to offer thrilling combat encounters and teamplay experiences.

Overwatch 2 comes with a 5v5 format , transitioning from its predecessor's 6v6 team structure, aiming to enhance strategic depth and overall gameplay experience. This made matchmaking much faster and with teams having only one frontline hero, it's up to the tank to press forward and make way for other teammates. With one less player on each team, matches become more focused and dynamic, encouraging tighter coordination and individual player impact. While some may miss the traditional format, many embrace the change to faster-paced matches and increased strategic depth.

Related
Overwatch 2 Hanaoka Map Has a Hidden Room
Some Overwatch 2 fans have discovered an easter egg on the new Hanaoka map in the form of a secret room near one of the spawn locations.

Luka Doncic Makes it to Top 500 in Overwatch 2

NBA superstar Luka Doncic has reached the coveted Top 500 rank in Overwatch 2. Notably, Doncic attained this feat while playing on a laptop, which makes the gameplay a tad harder unless it's a high-end gaming laptop. This achievement marks yet another instance of Doncic's passion for gaming, following his previous encounters in Grand Master lobbies and Twitch streams.

Despite his commitments with the Dallas Mavericks and their ongoing pursuit of a championship title, Doncic has demonstrated remarkable skill and dedication, positioning himself as one of the best players in competitive gaming. Posting his accomplishment on Instagram (as shared by Dexerto ), Doncic showcased his Top 500 Tank rank in Overwatch 2 's 10th season , obtained amid the busy playoffs.

Speaking of season 10, players are expecting the mid-season update very soon. May 14 promises excitement for Overwatch 2 fans as a collaboration with Porsche brings a special skin for D.Va, adding a new dimension to the gaming experience. This partnership reflects the game's popularity and its ability to attract collaborations beyond the gaming industry. Fans eagerly anticipate the release, with D.Va enthusiasts particularly thrilled about the new cosmetic addition.

The upcoming May 14 update for Overwatch 2 promises significant enhancements for tank players . Notable adjustments include a 25% reduction in damage from headshots, increased knockback resistance to 50%, and improvements to armor and HP recovery mechanics. Additionally, specific hero buffs are in store, with Wrecking Ball and Junker Queen receiving targeted enhancements to their abilities. As Overwatch 2 continues to evolve with updates and collaborations, Doncic's accomplishment adds to the game's appeal, attracting attention from both sports and gaming enthusiasts alike. With his dual success in basketball and gaming, Doncic exemplifies the versatility of modern athletes and the ever-expanding reach of esports into mainstream culture.

item.title: Gamer Discovers Nostalgic Gaming Achievement After 40 Years
item.description:
Highlights

  • Gaming achievements have evolved from tangible rewards in the 1980s to digital trophies on modern consoles like Xbox and PS.
  • The rediscovery of an Activision patch from 1983 has sparked nostalgia among gamers, showcasing the history of gaming milestones.
  • While physical awards like the Activision patches are rare now, some modern gaming competitions still offer unique prizes to winners.

A gamer was hit with a serious case of nostalgia after rediscovering their oldest gaming achievement award, dating back to 1983. The gaming achievement is bringing back fond memories for some gamers, while younger gamers are marveling about the way Activision celebrated gaming achievements long ago.

While in-game achievements have existed in some titles before consoles got involved, gamers really started to take note of achievements in the early 2000s. Starting with the Xbox 360 and PS3, achievement or trophy lists became an effective and exciting way to show one's progress in a game and brag about pulling off difficult tasks. To this day, some gamers feel they're not done with a game until they've completely polished off the achievement list, even if it means earning some of the most difficult gaming achievements to do so. However, some games had a tangible reward for certain achievements back in the 1980s, as one fan demonstrated.

Related
Fallout 4 Player Spends Over 1,000 Hours Unlocking the Game's Hardest Achievement
One Fallout 4 achievement has made players scratch their heads since the game's release, and this player spent a ridiculously long time chasing it.

Reddit user whyforyoulookmeonso shared a photo of a letter and an achievement patch they received from Activision back in the day for their accomplishments in the game Pitfall . Back in the day, the player photographed their TV screen, showing that they had earned at least 20,000 points in the game, and sent it in to Activision. The company, which had only existed for 4 years at that point, responded with the letter congratulating the player on their achievement and encouraging them to keep working hard in its titles. The patch, which could be ironed or sewn on to clothing, noted the player as a member of the Activision Explorers' Club, giving them a literal badge of honor to show off.

As it turns out, some other gamers on the site also fondly remember these 1980s nostalgic gaming patches, and either earned or tried to earn their own. While Pitfall was a popular game, it wasn't the only Activision title to get this treatment. In fact, there was a whole slew of releases from the game publisher that fans could earn achievements from, including Tennis , Space Shuttle , and Chopper Command . Pitfall 2 also had its own patch and achievement, tasking the player with earning 99,000 points to get a Cliff Hangers patch.

Gaming Awards Have (Mostly) Gone Digital

These days, gaming achievements are usually limited to a screen. Other than a record of points earned, there isn't much to physically show for clearing a game 100%. However, in some rare cases, physical awards have made a comeback. A chance to be added to the Xbox Hall of Fame , for example, came with an actual Xbox Series X for the winner. While the Activision patches are nostalgic, it's unfortunately unlikely that any major game publisher will do something like that as a regular thing ever again.

item.title: Pokemon Scarlet and Violet Players Pick The Paldea Region's Most Forgettable Pokemon
item.description:
Highlights

  • Pokemon Scarlet and Violet introduced 114 new monsters, but some are forgettable to players, like Brambleghast, due to lack of competitive use and unmemorable design.
  • Despite middling reviews, the games set themselves apart with the first fully open-world setting and offered more options for team building.
  • Brambleghast has defenders praising its Wind Rider ability, while other players consider Squawkabilly as another forgettable Pokemon in Generation 9.

Pokemon Scarlet and Violet brought a lot of new Pokemon into the franchise, but players are now debating which ones are the most forgettable. Pokemon Scarlet and Violet have introduced 114 new monsters to the Pokedex, including the ones in the base game and monsters added through DLC, but they weren't all created equal in players' minds.

Releasing in November 2022, the pair of games taking place in the Paldea Region are not the most well-received among Pokemon players, earning Pokemon Scarlet and Violet middling reviews from critics and mostly negative fan reviews on Metacritic. Still, the pair of games took the series in a new direction as the first mainline Pokemon game to take place in a fully open-world setting, which has set it apart from games in the previous eight generations. Pokemon Scarlet and Violet also gave players a lot more options for building their teams, offering up more new Pokemon than any game since Generation 5.

Related
Pokemon Scarlet and Violet Announce Seven-Star Tera Raid for May 2024
After a month-long break between battles, Pokemon Scarlet and Violet announce the next Seven-Star Tera Raid boss for trainers to take on.

At the top of a lot of players' lists of most forgettable Paldea Region Pokemon is Brambleghast (and, presumably, Bramblin, its unevolved form), the Grass/Ghost-type Tumbleweed Pokemon. While some players discussing the topic on Reddit noted that Brambleghast saw some competitive use in the game's early days, its absence on any notable trainers' teams along with it being all but forgotten in the DLC released for the pair of games didn't make for a memorable experience for some players. Adding to this, Brambleghast hardly looks like a Pokemon , and some players have criticized its move pool, as it can only learn 15 moves without the use of TMs, maxing out with Power Whip at level 55.

Not Everyone Forgot About Brambleghast

Even with all of its lack of action in Pokemon Scarlet and Violet compared to some more popular Pokemon , Brambleghast does seem to have its defenders. Some players praised its Wind Rider ability, which lets Brambleghast avoid all damage from wind moves, most of which comes from damage types that would normally be super effective against a Grass-type Pokemon.

While Brambleghast may not be the most memorable Pokemon introduced in Generation 9, other players have offered up other Pokemon for the title of most forgettable. One name that popped up multiple times was the oddly coiffed Squawkabilly , a Normal/Flying-type Pokemon resembling a parrot with a pompadour. While Squawkabilly comes in four different plumage colors, several players seem disillusioned with its common type pairing, giving it nicknames like "rock n roll Chatot" and "singing Taillow."

item.title: Helldivers 2 Dev Addresses Controversial Balance Updates
item.description:
Highlights

  • Helldivers 2 director Johan Pilestedt agrees with fans on game balance, promising talks with the team.
  • Arrowhead Game Studios appears to be putting more focus on player feedback for updates.
  • These comments from the Helldiver 2 director come after a recent controversy surrounding account linking.

Helldivers 2 director Johan Pilestedt agrees with fans that game balance updates have occasionally gone too far. Helldivers 2 is one of Sony's most popular games right now, and the new Polar Patriots Warbond is out. Because of the game's popularity and recent negative reception to updates, Arrowhead Game Studios' responses to feedback and PlayStation's approach to PC gaming fans have been the topic of frequent discussion.

Following the release of the Polar Patriots Warbond, gamers are excited about seeing all the new areas and weapons. Although players are looking forward to the additions in the game, some have had some criticisms about the way that Helldivers 2 weapon balance is implemented. Fans have suggested that the most fun weapons get nerfed and lose their appeal.

Related
Helldivers 2 Releases New Paid Warbond
Developer Arrowhead Game Studios launches the new Helldivers 2 premium warbond, introducing a range of new content for players.

Johan Pilestedt has responded to player criticism of balance changes, agreeing with the fan sentiment that "every time someone finds something fun, the fun is removed." Pilestedt has been listening to player feedback, as evidenced by his willingness to let players vote on the release date of the Helldivers 2 Polar Patriots Warbond , and Arrowhead Game Studios has been focusing on understanding fan reception to anything that might cause more friction surrounding the experience of Helldivers 2 . In response to feedback, the developer intends to reevaluate its approach to releasing balance updates.

Helldivers 2 has been embroiled in controversy lately. After it was announced that PC players would be required to link their accounts to the PlayStation Network, players responded by review bombing both Helldivers 2 and the original Helldivers . After the decision about PSN account linking was walked back, players celebrated and reverse-review bombed Helldivers 2 .

Fan Reception Appears to Be Arrowhead Games' Focus

Some gamers appear to consider now the best time to get their feedback over to Arrowhead, as the team currently seems to be the most attentive to fan reception it has ever been. This shift in the dynamic between the developer team and player base is in response to the way the massive backlash over the recent controversy risked the future of Helldivers 2 . This new approach includes developers looking into Helldivers 2 being delisted in several regions and figuring out how they can fix it. Arrowhead's new approach is a great thing for gamers who feel like they haven't had a say in how the games they want to play get made. If developers are more willing to listen about things like balance changes, then communities have more opportunities to actually shape the games they want to play as they're being made through updates.

item.title: New World of Warcraft: The War Within Character Has an Amazing Detail
item.description:
Highlights

  • Faerin Lothar is a unique Arathi Lamplighter with a prosthetic shield arm who helps protect Hallowfall in World of Warcraft: The War Within.
  • Hallowfall, the third region in The War Within, features dynamic environmental lighting effects and is guarded by the Lamplighters, led by Faerin Lothar.
  • Faerin's design and personality are sure to make her a fan favorite in The War Within, as she stands out with her prosthetic arm and go-getter attitude.

Faerin Lothar, a new character from World of Warcraft: The War Within , has a prosthetic limb in the form of a shield. This awesome new World of Warcraft character will accompany players in the Hallowfall region in The War Within , where her unique fighting style will literally help save the day.

Hallowfall is the third region World of Warcraft players will explore in The War Within . Dominated by a color-shifting crystal that features World of Warcraft s first dynamic environmental lighting effect , the Arathi of Hallowfall revere the Sacred Flame. The Lamplighters are a group of Paladins who go out of their way to protect the people of Hallowfall by keeping the dawntowers lit, and the darkness at bay.

Related
You Can Do More Than Pet The Cat in World of Warcraft: The War Within
World of Warcraft fans who fancy felines should look forward to The War Within, as they can do more than simply pet the cats they encounter.

Among the Lamplighters, Faerin Lothar is a paragon, and one of the first Arathi players meet in Hallowfall. She is a stalwart champion of the Light who is the first to act when people are in danger, and her compassion and friendship with Anduin is central to the story of the World of Warcaft: The War Within . However, Faerin has a special detail about her: she lost her left arm and eye to an injury 15 years ago. In spite of that, Faerin is a skilled fighter, and by wielding a prosthetic arm in the form of a shield, the Lamplighter is no stranger to the front lines.

Who is Faerin Lothar in WoW: The War Within?

  • Faerin is an Arathi Lamplighter a type of World of Warcraft Paladin who maintains the lighthouse-like dawntowers.
  • She is extremely distantly related to Anduin Lothar the late Stormwind hero and Anduin Wrynn's namesake whom she likely shares an ancient lineage with.
  • She lost an arm and an eye in an injury 15 years ago, but fights with a prosthetic shield arm.

World of Warcraft has depicted injuries like Faerins in the past. Characters like the Blood Elf regent Lorthemar Theron have one eye, and most player characters can even give themselves similar blind eye customizations. That said, prosthetics are much less common, with only Mechagnomes, demons like the Moarg, and Shattered Hand orcs like Kargath Bladefist being some of the only examples. According to some The War Within dialogue captured by Wowhead , Faerin is even more unique in that she chooses not to wear a prosthetic off the battlefield, as she is already used to living without an arm.

By and large, the vast majority of players are excited to learn more about Faerin. Her design is exceptionally striking, and her go-getter personality is sure to win hearts. Though The War Within is set to introduce several interesting characters, Faerin is likely to become a fan favorite especially considering she is also the star of one of the new The War Within short stories World of Warcraft is releasing this November .
